cab.content: Secret.917This Document is the Property of His Britannic Ma]esty's G //eminent(3t from Viceroij, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,23rd May 1919,40432 Special dated 22nd May.6984. Part I. Air reconnaissance report no movements of importance east of Jalalabad. Afghan troops on Dakka front reported having difficulty with ration supply, and local lashkars disinclined to concentrate for same reason. Amir's household troops reported to have lost heavily in recent fighting. Reports from Mohmand country still (? conflicting), but Afghan force in Gandao apparently composed of battalions from Sarkanri and elements of battalion from Chighaserai and of two new improvised units from Jalalabad; total strength of this force probably not exceeding 1,000. Mohmands still quiet. Afridi deputation proceeding to Jalalabad turned back dissatisfied at reception by Afghans All quiet Bazar Valley. No change Kurram, Tochi, Gomal, Zhob or Chaman.Part II. No active operations have been reported except the effective bombing of troops at Kahi and Pesjbolak.if it
